cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 525 miles SE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest today, turning northwest Wednesday and moving toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts Wednesday night, then inland Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas-Louisiana border (around Cameron/Port Arthur area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning east of Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River; Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass, TX to Intracoastal City, LA; Storm Surge Warning San Luis Pass, TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts, with effects extending eastward across southeast Louisiana to the Mississippi coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) likely late Wednesday night through Thursday; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if the track shifts east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge of 4–6 ft possible from Morgan City to the Mouth of the Mississippi River, with water level rises propagating up the Mississippi River toward port facilities.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible, producing flash and urban flooding along the lower Mississippi River corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous waves and river currents, possible tornadoes in rain bands, and port-channel restrictions due to high water and debris.
